item.title: Dex is an AI-powered camera device that helps children learn new languages
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: A new gadget called Dex allows kids to take pictures of objects and the AI translates the word into different languages.

item.title: Thousands of Grok chats are now searchable on Google
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Whenever a Grok user clicks the “share” button on a conversation with the chatbot, it creates a unique URL that the user can use to share the conversation via email, text or on social media. According to Forbes, that also makes the URL indexable by search engines like Google, Bing, and DuckDuckGo, which in turn lets anyone look up those conversations on the web.

item.title: New zero-day startup offers $20 million for tools that can hack any smartphone
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: Prices for hacking tools that allow governments to break into mobile phones keep going up, thanks to efforts by tech firms shoring up their cybersecurity.

item.title: FieldAI raises $405M to build universal robot brains
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: FieldAI builds foundational AI models that help all kinds of robots learn and adapt to new environments using physics.

item.title: Y Combinator alum SRE.ai raises $7.2M for DevOps AI agents
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The company helps automate complex enterprise workflows (like continuous integration and testing) — or, in other words, it makes DevOps capabilities more efficient as AI technology takes hold.

item.title: YC-backed Garage raises $13.5M to help firefighters buy equipment
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Garage is a marketplace that sells specialized equipment commonly used in local governments and public safety.

item.title: Zoox taps ex-UberPool exec’s startup for routing software help
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: It's the latest in a series of deals that have seen robotaxi companies look outward for help in scaling their fledgling networks.

item.title: Finally, Notion now works without an internet connection
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: For years, one of the most annoying issues with using Notion was that you couldn't get much done offline because of its cloud-first architecture. The company has finally solved that problem, adding support for an offline mode to its apps.

item.title: Deel scores a lawsuit win, but not against Rippling
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: While Deel is calling this a "Rippling-aligned" suit, it's not the lawsuit filed by Rippling involving an alleged corporate spy.

item.title: Made by Google 2025: How to watch Google debut the Pixel 10, Pixel Watch 4, and more
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Google is hosting its Pixel 10 event next week. Learn how to watch the tech giant reveal its new mobile devices and what else you can expect.

item.title: Appeals court says NLRB structure unconstitutional, in a win for SpaceX
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: SpaceX scored a win in a decision from the Fifth Circuit over the labor board's structure.

item.title: Google pays $30M to settle lawsuit over children’s YouTube data
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Google has agreed to pay $30M to settle a lawsuit over children's data collection, though the company denies wrongdoing.

item.title: Meta is shaking up its AI org, again
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom
item.description: On Friday, The Information reported that Meta was preparing to tear down its existing AI org and reorganize it into four new groups. Four days later, the change has been made official with an internal memo.

item.title: Discover how developer tools are shifting fast with Lauri Moore and David Cramer at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: From no-code to AI-assisted dev environments, “vibe coding” is changing how early-stage startups build — and who they need to hire. The once-standard idea of landing a “10x engineer” as your first critical hire is getting a serious reality check with Lauri Moore (Bessemer) and David Cramer (Sentry) on the Builder Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 in October at San Francisco's Moscone West.

item.title: Databricks CEO says fresh $1B will help him attack a new AI database market
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The round, which pushes Databricks' valuation to $100B, was co-led by Insight Partners and Thrive. CEO Ali Ghodsi says he's found an enormous untapped AI agent market to spend the funds.

item.title: Meta rolls out AI-powered translations to creators globally, starting with English and Spanish
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The new feature, which is available in any market where Meta AI is available, allows creators to translate content into other languages for a broader audience.

item.title: Your next customer is on the TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 expo floor — will they find you or your competitor?
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: There’s still time to book your exhibit table, but space is disappearing fast. The brands that move now will be the ones getting the face time, the leads, and the traction that matters most.

item.title: India’s government to propose blanket ban on real-money gaming
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The Indian government plans to ban real-money games — whether skill- or chance-based — under its proposed online gaming regulation.

item.title: TechCrunch Mobility: Ford’s big bet
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Welcome back to TechCrunch Mobility, your central hub for news and insights on the future of transportation.

item.title: Aalo Atomics raises $100M to build a microreactor and data center together
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Nuclear startup Aalo Atomics plans to turn on its first power plant, the 50-megawatt Aalo-X, in the summer of 2026. It's an aggressive timeline that bucks nuclear industry trends.
